duck: Collaborative search engine – a search engine which actively or passively accounts for user behavior in ranking results
seeks definition: a children's game in which one player does not look while others hide and then goes to find them.
OpenSearch – a standard protocol for publishing search results in a consumable format
YaCy – an open source search engine written in Java which includes its own crawler
Faroo – a proprietary, P2P search engine for .NET Framework
Seeks is a Free Software/open source project licensed under the Affero General Public License version 3 (AGPLv3).

Blekko - Blekko, trademarked as blekko, is a company that provides a web search engine with the stated goal of providing better search results than those offered by Google Search, with results gath...

'Seeks' is a Free Software/open source project licensed under the Affero General
Public License version 3 (AGPLv3). It exists to create an alternative search
engine to the current commercially available market leading search engines which
is driven by user concerns rather than corporate interests.<ref></ref> The
original manifesto was created by Emmanuel Benazera and Sylvio Drouin and
published in October 2006.<ref></ref> Since then, the project has been under
active development and stable releases of the engine are available for public
use in addition to various distributions of the source code for adventurous
users. In September 2011, Seeks won an innovation award at the open world
forum.<ref></ref>
wiki.title: seeks
